I think the thing is that there are some of us here (well, at least one and=
 maybe two) who could care less what the rest of the world thinks. We aren'=
t out to prove anything to the world. We're not intertestid in "studies" or=
 "grants." We know what we can get and we just do it for the enjoyment of h=
earing the EVP/ITC communication ourselves

    I am in this category and I=
 have a feeling Frank is to some extent, too.

    Zack.


    On Tue, May =
5, 2009 at 5:03 PM, almovadar <almovadar@...> wrote:




      Any se=
rious student and researcher of EVP knows that VERY VERY controlled studies=
 of the EVP phenomenon go back at least 30 years to the first Pye Recording=
 Studio Tests that where originally set up and paid for by and Editor of a =
newspaper covering the phenomenon. The editor was NOT in any way convinced =
that EVP was real... Independent sound engineers from Pye were brought in..=
. the result? Voices... hundreds of them... Ultimately result? The paper di=
dn't release the result anyway...

      There was also a very controlled e=
xperiment done in a Faraday Cage... and if memory serves was mentioned in t=
he Journal for the American Psychical Society.

      The point I'm trying =
to make here is that VERY controlled experiments are not new in this arena.=
.. 

      I've been involved in the area of EVP for well over a decade now=
... I don't wish to convinced anyone of anything thats tantamount to a damn=
ed religious conversion...

      Hans Holzer summed it up well... "The wil=
l to disbelieve is greater than the will to believe."

      As researchers=
, many of us have moved well beyond the question of: Do they (the voices) e=
xist?"... Many of us are now asking: "What does it all mean?" in a more spi=
ritual context...

      The group that recieved the grant I suspect are th=
emselves members of the AA-EVP group at large. I recognize at LEAST 3 membe=
rs from the consciousness studies dept (the former) at the University of Ar=
izona as well who have now formed this (in my opinion) new agey group study=
ing human potential... Very 70's at first glance...

      Louis
